text: Which of the following persons invented the punch card machine?
explanation: Dr. Herman Hollerith developed the punch card system for data processing in the late 19th century, which was widely used for the 1890 U.S. Census. His system used punched cards to store data, which could be processed using electric machines to count and analyze the information much more efficiently than manual methods.

text: Convert \(47_8\) to its binary equivalent.
explanation:
Convert to base 10 first.
\(47_8\) = 4 x \(8^1\) + 7 x \(8^0\) = \(39_{10}\)
Then convert \(39_{10}\) to base 2 as follows
239219 R 129 R 124 R 122 R 021 R 020 R 1
Therefore \(47_8\) is equivalent to \(100111_2\)

explanation: Data collection is defined as the procedure of collecting, measuring and analyzing accurate insights for research using standard validated techniques. All the other processes help to achieve this apart from option D.

explanation: Information analysis procedures involve the following i. skim and scan ii.recognize omission and faulty logic iii. determine accuracy, relevance and reliability of information iv. differentiate, identify propaganda/bias vi. recognize interrelationships.Therefore OPTION C is Correct.

text: The advantages of electronic data processing includes the following except
Which of the following is not a transmission medium?
explanation: A transmission medium is something that can mediate the propagation of signals for the purposes of telecommunication. Amodemis a device or program that enables a computer to transmit data and so cannot be regarded as a transmission medium.

Which of the following are the basic components of a computer network? I. A minimum of two computers II. Printers III. Network interface card.
explanation: The key parts required to set up a computer network are called Basic Computer Network. The components of a Computer Network: are a Network Interface Card(NIC), HUB, Switch, Repeater, Router, Modem, Server, Bridge.

text: The spreadsheet symbol used to convert a number to a label is
explanation: An apostrophe before a cell value forces Excel to interpret the value as label. This is mostly useful for values that look like a number or date.

text: In spreadsheets, data would not be accepted into a cell by pressing the.
explanation:
Entering Data in MS Excel
A cell is selected in which a particular text is to be written and then enter is pressed.The tab key is used to feed the same data in different cells of Excel.Arrow keys are used to jump from one cell to another and then feed data accordingly to a particular cell.Esc cancels an entry in the cell or Formula Bar.

text: A field in a database table is also known as
explanation: A field, also known as a column or attribute, represents a single piece of data within a database table. It corresponds to a specific characteristic or property of the entities being stored in the table.

explanation: Dragging is the term used when we press and hold the left mouse key and move the mouse around the slide. As we drag, a shadow object shows us where the object will land when we release the mouse button.

text: Which of the following is not a safety equipment in a computer laboratory?
Which of the following is not a computer professional?
explanation: Computer professionals are individuals employed in the field of information technology, for example, hardware or software engineers, web designers, network or database administrators, computer science instructors, computer repair technicians, etc.

The diagram illustrates the relationship between two tables in a database.
The student ID in Tables II is referred to as
explanation:
B. foreign key
This is because it links to the primary key (student ID) in Table I, establishing a relationship between the two tables.

text:
The diagram illustrates the relationship between two tables in a database.
 
What type of relationship exists between Tables I and II?
explanation: A one-to-many relationship is the most common kind of relationship. In this kind of relationship, a row in table A can have many matching rows in table B. But a row in table B can have only one matching row in table A.  A one-to-many relationship is created if only one of the related columns is a primary key or has a unique constraint.

text: A program developed to protect the computer from malicious software is referred to as
explanation: Antivirus software, or anti-virus software, also known as anti-malware, is a computer program used to prevent, detect, and remove malware.

text: One of the advantages of a parallel database is
In a relational database management system, files are organized as relations and
explanation: A tuple, also known as a record or row, is a basic unit of data in a relational database management system (DBMS). A tuple represents a single instance of a relation, or table, in the database. Each tuple contains a set of values, or attributes, that correspond to the columns, or fields, of the relation.

text: The exchange of information over a network follows a set of rules called
explanation: Protocol, in computer science, a set of rules or procedures for transmitting data between electronic devices, such as computers.
